llg4 Module¶

This module defines an alternative class for the numerical integration of the LLG.

class magnumfe.llg4.LLG4(mesh, material, scale=1.0, demag_order=2)¶

Bases: object

This class defines methods for the numerical integration of the LLG. The effective field includes exchange, demagnetization and external field terms. The exchange field and the demagnetization field are treated implicitly.

calculate_dm(m, dt, h_ext=None)¶

Calculate the dm for a given magnetization configuration and timestep by the method proposed by Alouge. The demagnetization is computed with the shell- transformation method and implicitly coupled.

Arguments
m
The magnetization configuration.
dt
The timestep.
h_ext
The external field.
interpolate(expr)¶
step(m, dt, h_ext=None)¶

Calculate m(t+dt) for a given m(t) and dt following the semiimplicit method proposed by Alouge. The effective field consists of the stray field and the exchange field. An optional external field can be passed as argument.

Arguments
m
The magnetization configuration.
dt
The timestep.
h_ext
The external field.

llg_alouges_lagrange Module¶

This module defines a class for the numerical integration of the LLG.

class magnumfe.llg_alouges_lagrange.LLGAlougesLagrange(terms=[], scale=1.0)¶

Bases: object

This class defines methods for the numerical integration of the LLG. The effective field includes exchange, demagnetization and external field terms.

calculate_v(state, dt)¶

Calculate v for a given magnetization configuration and timestep by the semiimplicit method proposed by Alouge.

Arguments
state
The magnetization configuration.
dt
The timestep.
step(state, dt)¶

Calculate m(t+dt) for a given m(t) and dt following the semiimplicit method proposed by Alouge.

Arguments
state
The magnetization configuration.
dt
The timestep.

material Module¶

This module defines a material class for micromagnetic problems.

class magnumfe.material.Material(**kwargs)¶

Bases: object

This class defines a material with micromagnetic properties.

static py()¶

Return an instance of Material with the material properties similar to Permalloy.

spin_diffusion Module¶

wrapped_mesh Module¶

This module defines a class for the handling of meshes with shells as used for the stray-field transformation method.

class magnumfe.wrapped_mesh.WrappedMesh(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: dolfin.cpp.mesh.Mesh

This class represents a mesh with a certain submesh and defines methods for the fast interpolation between the two meshes.

static create(mesh, domain_ids, invert=False)¶

Creates a wrapped mesh from a super mesh with subdomains and a given subdomain number.

Arguments
mesh
The mesh.
domain_ids
List of domain IDs
invert
Invert list of domain IDs
cut(f, **kwargs)¶

Takes a function defined on the super mesh and returns a truncated function defined on the sub mesh.

Arguments
f
The function on the super mesh.
expand(f, **kwargs)¶

Takes a function defined on the sub mesh and returns a function defined on the super mesh with unknown value set to zero.

Arguments
f
The function on the sub mesh.
init(mesh_with_shell)¶

Creates a _WrappedMesh_. This method is not supposed to be called by the end user. Use the static create() method instead.
